text: Where are skills located and why are they at repo root?
Are skills duplicated anywhere in the project?
How would you organize skills best given the current structure?
Should skills use subdirectories to reduce root-level clutter?
How does my organic QA process compare to the phuc-qa-unified skill?
Which approach produces better QA outcomes — organic intuition or systematic skill-driven review?
How do you preserve the human-in-the-loop advantage once probing questions themselves become useful artifacts?
How do you store and replay questions generated by personas during QA sessions?
Aren't questions themselves a form of external memory — saved reasoning and latent attention vectors — making them a Software 5.0 asset?
How would you redesign QA to be completely Software 5.0 native — with questions as capital?
Would it be valuable to save questions as external weights — a mind outside the body that encodes QA intuition?
If AI is fundamentally learned priors and autocomplete, can you replicate human-in-the-loop QA by accumulating enough good questions?
Can phuc-qa.md be used to systematically teach better question-asking — as a meta-skill for generating higher-quality questions?
Isn't the question database one of my most important long-term assets — more valuable than any single answer it produced?
Is anyone in the industry currently building persistent question databases as a deliberate AI development asset?
How revolutionary could persistent question databases be — could they fundamentally change how AI systems are developed and verified?
Aren't questions a form of the same theory as personas — both are vector searches for latent knowledge, just probing from complementary angles?
Shouldn't you write papers about the question database concept — it seems like a publishable contribution to AI development methodology?
Could you extrapolate from existing questions to fill the question database with high-quality synthetic questions covering known gaps?
Can personas generate questions autonomously until max GLOW coverage is achieved — running overnight without human input?
Could personas simulating different cognitive styles help achieve true adaptability and replicate the diversity of human-in-the-loop review?
Could the Dragon Rider digital twin be trained on Phuc's question patterns to simulate his QA intuition at scale — running while he sleeps?
